humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a tumor size of 55 mm (5.5 cm) for the invasive ductal carcinoma. Based on the rules provided, T3 tumors are defined as being more than 5 cm in size. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is based on the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded the chest wall or skin. In this report, the tumor size is specified as 55 mm, which is larger than the threshold for T3 (greater than 50 mm). The report also mentions 'completely circumscribed invasion of the lymph vessels' but does not indicate chest wall or skin invasion. Therefore, based on the size of the tumor, the T stage is T3.
